int CGenList::setDamageColumnAlwaysOn ( int columnNumber )
 

int CGenList::setDamageColumnAlwaysOff ( int columnNumber )
 

int CGenList::isDamageColumnAlways ( int columnNumber )
 

If on, it tells the widget to redraw the column when the column's position or size changes, even if it doesn't seem necessary. For example, if a right-aligned column is made narrower but its right edge doesn't move, there's no need to redraw the column. The flag can be set to force a redraw, which needs to be done if the column contains some elements that aren't right-aligned. This flag is usually set by the child class of CGenList that knows what's drawn in the columns.

int CGenList::setColumnPos ( int columnNumber,
int from,
int to )
 

Sets the positions of the left and right edges of the column (relative to the left edge of widget's canvas).

int CGenList::setBalloonAsRequiredOff ( )
 

int CGenList::isBalloonAsRequired ( )
 

If on, shows a balloon if the contents of the list are clipped

int CGenList::setColumnBalloonsOn ( )
 

int CGenList::setColumnBalloonsOff ( )
 

int CGenList::isColumnBalloons ( )
 

If on, displays balloons for individual columns, not the entire row.

int CGenList::setBoundaryKeyEventsOn ( )
 

int CGenList::setBoundaryKeyEventsOff ( )
 

int CGenList::isBoundaryKeyEvents ( )
 

If this flag is clear (the default), cursor key events (/\, \/, Pg Up, Pg Down, Home, and End) are always consumed by the widget. If this flag is set, a cursor key event is consumed only if it actually changes the current item. For example, an /\ or Home event won't be consumed if the first item in the list is already the current item.

int CGenList::setHeaderAutoresizeOff ( )
 

int CGenList::isHeaderAutoresize ( )
 

When the scrollbar is realized or unrealized, adjust the size of the CDivider widget (if there is one).

int CGenList::isScrollbarAlways ( )
 

If setScrollbarAsRequired is selected, the scrollbar is only visible, if the list items don't fit the list

If on, the scrollbar automatically resized when the size of the header changes.

int CGenList::setListSnapOn ( )
 

int CGenList::setListSnapOff ( )
 

int CGenList::isListSnap ( )
 

If on, makes the list snap to fit the number of items. Note that is set to off automatically if the items in the list don't have equal heights.

int CGenList::setListFont ( char * listFont )
 

Sets the font used for the items in the list

int CGenList::getNumItems ( )
 

Returns the number of list items, -1 in case of error

int CGenList::setScrollRate ( int scrollRate )
 

If you drag in a list and move outside the widget, the list scrolls at a rate determined by the number of "button repeats". This resource specifies the number of button repeats that must be received before scrolling occurs. The default value is 2. To make the scrolling faster, set this resource to 1; to make scrolling slower, set this resource to a larger number.

int CGenList::getNumSelectedItems ( )
 

Returns the number of selected items, -1 in case of error

int CGenList::getListTotalHeight ( )
 

Returns the total height (in pixels) of all items, -1 in case of error

int CGenList::setScrollbarWidth ( int scrollbarWidth )
 

Sets the width of the accompanying scrollbar, if displayed. The minimum width is 6 pixels. If you set this resource to 0, the default width of 15 is used.

int CGenList::setSelectionFillColor ( PgColor_t selectionFillColor )
 

Sets the fill color for selected items

int CGenList::setBrowseSelectionMode ( )
 

In this mode, to select an item using the mouse, the user either clicks on an item or drags the the pointer down the list and releases the mouse button when the correct item is highlighted. The user can select only one item. If the user drags the mouse, the list can be scrolled.

int CGenList::setMultipleSelectionMode ( )
 

In this mode, to select multiple items using the mouse, the user clicks on more than one item. When the user clicks on a selected item, the item is released.

int CGenList::setExtendedSelectionMode ( )
 

In this mode, Click-Shift-click/drag and Ctrl-click combinations are supported to select multiple items. To select all items between and including two items in a list, the user clicks on the first item, presses the Shift key, then clicks on or drags to any other item in the list. To select multiple disjoint items, the user holds down the Ctrl while clicking on selected items.

int CGenList::setSingleSelectionMode ( )
 

In this mode, to select an item the user points to the item, then clicks the mouse button. The user can select only one item. If the user selects a second item, the first is released.

int CGenList::setRangeSelectionMode ( )
 

In this mode, To select a range of items the user points to the first item, drags to the last item in the range, then releases the mouse button. When the user is dragging the mouse, the list can be scrolled.

int CGenList::setSelectionTextColor ( PgColor_t selectionTextColor )
 

Sets the color for selected items

int CGenList::setTopItem ( int topItemPosition )
 

The item index that appears at the top of the list. (The first item is 1.) Setting this resource will cause the widget to draw if damaged and possibly blit afterwards. The widget doesn't blit when its fill color transparent.

int CGenList::getNumVisibleItems ( )
 

Returns the number of visible items, -1 in case of error

void CGenList::addListScrollCallback ( PtCallbackF_t callbackFunction,
void * data = 0 )
 

Adds a callback that is invoked when the top item changes (the list scrolls to a new position
